title: Regulations on Rare Earth Management
summary_1: The regulation aims to protect and utilize rare earth resources effectively, promoting high-quality development of the industry.
summary_2: It applies to all activities related to the mining, refining, and trading of rare earths within China.
summary_3: The regulation emphasizes the dual focus on resource protection and development, adhering to principles of safety, innovation, and green development.

translation: The State Council of the People's Republic of China has issued the 'Regulations on Rare Earth Management,' which were approved at the 31st executive meeting on April 26, 2024, and will be effective from October 1, 2024. The regulations are designed to protect and utilize rare earth resources effectively, promote high-quality development of the rare earth industry, and ensure ecological and national resource security. They apply to activities such as mining, refining, and trading of rare earths within China. The regulations emphasize the importance of balancing resource protection with development, adhering to principles of safety, innovation, and green development. Rare earth resources are state-owned, and unauthorized exploitation or damage is prohibited. The regulations also introduce a system for total quantity control and dynamic management of rare earth mining and refining.

title: Establishment of Expert Group for Rectifying Rare Earth Industry Order
summary_1: The Rare Earth Office has established an expert group to support the rectification of the rare earth industry.
summary_2: The group consists of experts in technology, finance, and law.
summary_3: The initiative aims to institutionalize and normalize the crackdown on illegal activities in the rare earth sector.
summary_4: Experts will assist in production technology analysis, raw material composition testing, financial data analysis, and legal administration.
summary_5: Members are drawn from industry associations, key rare earth groups, and research and legal institutions.

insight_2: Analysts should assess how the institutionalization of enforcement might affect market dynamics and compliance costs.
insight_3: Policymakers should consider the implications of China's regulatory approach on international rare earth trade and security.

key_provision_2: Focus on technology, financial, and legal expertise to aid enforcement.
key_provision_3: Normalization and institutionalization of rare earth industry regulation.
key_provision_4: Support for production technology analysis and raw material testing.
key_provision_5: Financial data analysis and legal administration as key areas of focus.

translation: To continuously advance the special action against illegal activities in the rare earth sector and gradually institutionalize and normalize the rectification work, the Rare Earth Office has established an expert group composed of experts in technology, finance, and law. This group will provide support and assistance in areas such as production technology analysis, raw material composition testing, financial data analysis, and legal administration for the rectification of the rare earth industry order. The members of the expert group mainly come from relevant industry associations, key rare earth groups, and research and legal institutions.
